title: Free courses for tourism workers
category: Supporting businesses to get back to normal
background_info_description: According to the Minister of Tourism, Julia Farrugia Portelli, the tourism industry is likely to be very different post COVID-19 and thus training is necessary upskill all individuals who wish to work in this sector.Consequently, an online platform was developed which included hundreds of courses for workers of this sector. All courses were offered for free. Funding originated from funds which were set aside for tourism pre COVID-19.
content_of_measure_description: The Ministry for Tourism and Consumer Protection, in collaboration with the Malta Tourism Authority (MTA), launched an e-learning training scheme for the tourism industry. The aim was to empower and educate the workforce to return stronger when the industry is no longer on hold. It was estimated that up to 25,000 may make use of this opportunity which was not only available to employers and employees in this sector, but also to students studying tourism studies, those who wish to take up a part-time job in tourism, as well as those who are unemployed by may want to take up a new career in tourism. All courses were financed by the MTA, were carried out remotely and were offered by over 30 service providers, including the University of Malta, the Institute of Tourism Studies, UNESCO and several English Language Schools which provided English courses. Other covered topics included management and leadership skills, personal skills, self-development, customer care, and specific industry-related skills. The scheme is a one-year project.Interested individuals were able to apply for up to three short courses or one longer accredited course. Courses were offered on a first come first served basis.
use_of_measure_description: It was announced that nearly €6 million had been spent on the scheme. Between 5,000 and 6,000 individuals who chose to enrol in up to three short courses completed their studies. A further 2,000 were in the process of undertaking a longer accredited course.
involvement_of_social_partners_descripti: No specific social partner involvement was announced with regards to this measure. The Malta Hotels and Restaurants Association (MHRA) has been very vocal in pushing for measures that would help the sector since the beginning of COVID-19; the sector was amongst one of the hardest hit and benefitted from several other measures such as vouchers that could be used in their establishments being distributed to the population, as well as wage, rent and electricity subsidies, amongst others.

Maps                                                                Close                                    Send By E-Mail                                                                                    From (Name)*                                                                                                                                                                                        From (E-Mail)*                                                                                                                                                                                                                To (Name)                        *                                                                                                                                                                                        To (E-Mail)*                                                                                                                                                                                                                Message                                                                The following map might be of interest to you:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        E-Learning                         The Ministry for Tourism and Consumer Protection and the Malta Tourism Authority invite you to apply for any of the hundreds of courses being made available to you for free. The various courses are being offered via on-line platforms.Take your time to visit the websites listed below and browse through these courses to see what suits you best, before you apply.It is important to take note of the essential points below:	Before you apply have a scan or photo of your ID card ready	Have a letter/declaration of employment from your employer stating your current job title	For student applicants: to provide evidence as full-time students with a local or foreign training institution following a tourism-related course.  This does not apply ONLY in the case of school-leavers (Form 5) and Sixth Form students.  In the case of these students, evidence that they are full-time students from the School Registrar is required	Unemployed applicants are requested to provide their ETC social security registration and a recently dated copy of their employment from JobsPlus which shows past employment in the tourism sector	For accredited/higher level courses make sure you have scans of your qualifications (in case they are requested)	You may apply for a maximum of 3 short courses OR 1 accredited course	The courses are free, but certain Terms & Conditions do apply according to the service provider selected	For any questions in relation to a specific course, contact the training institution directly	Applicants are to register their interest by latest Saturday, 16th of May at 5pmCandidates will be selected on a first come first served basis. The MTCP and the MTA reserve the right to refuse any applications if the allocated budget is exceeded.  	 	SERVICE PROVIDER	LINK	 	 	 	Academy for Inner Excellence	https://www.innerexcellenceacademy.com/courses/mta-mtcp-e-learning-courses/	 	 	Advenio e-Academy	https://aea.academy/mta-scheme/	 	 	Alliance Française de Malte-Méditerranée	http://alliancefr.org.mt/Home/Courses.aspx#mta	 	 	Alta Formazione Pratica by SWEB Web Marketing Training	https://www.corsi-web-roma.com/englishonlinecourse.html	 	 	AM Language	https://www.amlanguage.com/am-practical-english-for-work-in-the-tourism-sector/	 	 	Atlantic Language School	https://www.atlanticlanguage.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/information-for-web-page-of-the-project-atlantic-language-and-malta-online-courses.pdf	 	 	Avanza Academy	http://mta.avanza.com.mt	 	 	BELS English Language Schools	https://belsmalta.com/mta-course-page/	 	 	Easy School of Languages  	https://www.easysl.com/english-for-tourism	 	https://www.easysl.com/ecommerce-practices-level4	 	https://www.easysl.com/diploma-in-sme-management-level5	 	 	EC English	https://www.ecenglish.com/en/maltatourism 	 	 	EF International Language Campuses - sources.title: KPMG - Elearning for tourism
sources.content: E-learning training scheme for the tourism industry - KPMG Malta closeShare with your friends						Insights	Industries	Services	Careers	EventsPlease note that your account has not been verified - unverified account will be deleted 48 hours after initial registration. You will not receive KPMG subscription messages until you agree to the new policy.Ignore and log outContinueCloseHi!CloseContinue	Home›	Insights›E-learning training scheme for the tourism industryE-learning training scheme for the tourism industryE-learning training scheme for the tourism industryAn e-learning platform has been launched offering free online courses to individuals working in the tourism sectors.Share1000SaveAlso on home.kpmgDuring a press conference held on 8 May 2020, the Ministry for Tourism and Consumer Protection, together with the Malta Tourism Authority (MTA), launched an e-learning platform offering free online courses to individuals working in the tourism sectors. The courses are financed by MTA. The content of the courses covers a variety of skills and occupational levels including management and leadership skills, personal skills, self-development, customer care, linguistic skills and specific industry-related skills. The scheme is a one-year project.Whilst tourism is on hold, this incentive is aimed at making the best use of employee and employer resources in these challenging times and empower the workforce to come back stronger and better after the COVID-19 pandemic.The list of courses can be accessed from the portal of the Institute of Tourism Studies*.Should you have any queries or wish to discuss further, please send an email to covid@kpmg.com.mt.*8.7.2020 - removed from Institute of Tourism Studies website since date of publicationThe information contained herein is of a general nature and is not intended to address the circumstances of any particular individual or entity. Although we endeavour to provide accurate and timely information, there can be no guarantee that such information is accurate as of the date it is received or that it will continue to be accurate in the future.
